intro: Diplusodon ciliatiflorus, commonly known as the hairy-flowered diplusodon, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers with distinctive hairy structures around the base. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptation and biodiversity.
